title: Raising the roof
body: Before the walls could go up, the ventilation system had to be lifted as close to the ceiling as possible. We could've paid someone to do it, but that's not the "Chilton" way. So, last Thursday, Dad and I spent an evening raising the roof... or rather, raising the ductwork TO the roof. Before we started working, I checked to see if the vinyl we had left over from the "OPENING SOON" sign would fit over the windows. Since we're blocking them up, we need something on the back of the windows so it doesn't look tacky from the outside. This is still a work in progress. Nothing to see here... just a really cool guy (bearded) deftly maneuvering down the side of some scaffolding with a bolt of red vinyl in his hand. HOT! The first two steps in raising a ventilation system are 1) making sure your level is working (dad - on the left), and 2) rolling up your sleeves (me - on the right). Next, lift up the ductwork and place it on your head (me) while someone checks to see if it's level (dad). If you're wearing a hat, continually complain that the bead on top of your hat is digging into your skull, but yet do nothing about it. Step four, stand and wait. Posing - optional. Beard - not optional. Here's another good shot. Notice how high we are off the ground, yet neither myself or my dad (hidden) are the least bit frightened. Amazing what beer can do. I'm not sure what's going on here, but it looks like I'm making the international gesture for a blowjob. No. Seriously though... that's exactly what I'm doing. Here's my dad screwing in a sheet metal screw into the duct. You can tell by his tongue that he's focusing really hard. I guess that's better than making the blowjob gesture though. Here's what the ducts looked like BEFORE we lifted them up. Here's what they looked like AFTER we lifted them up. Notice the additional sheet metal screw? That's for safety. This is one of the screens on the window. Sometime over the last few weeks, the visage of Jabba the Hut has miraculously appeared on the window. Nicole thinks it's a sign of the apocalypse; I think it's a subversive marketing technique perpetrated by George Lucas in preparation for the May release of Revenge of the Sith. Either way, we're selling it on eBay. This is a toilet air pipe filled with GIANT cockroaches. It's located between the bathrooms. I'm not lying when I say there are at least 2,593 cockroaches in that pipe. Nor am I lying when I say they're about 3 inches long. I am, however, slightly exaggerating when I tell you that right after I snapped this picture, I put my lips over the top of the pipe and sucked them all up into my mouth. They're now living happily in my beard.
author: Dan

comments.author: whitty
comments.body: BAH!  Those cockroaches are not a good surprise ending, they are a very bad surprise ending!  You might as well have told me that Bruce Willis is really dead.  BAH!

comments.author: Allison
comments.body: on the bright side, it would be really fun to take a can of raid and just watch them drop off the side of the pipe.

comments.author: Rachel
comments.body: Oh gross gross gross.  But...if those cockroaches had beards...

comments.author: Dave
comments.body:
dude. i read this with a mouthfull of burrito. you should have some kind of grossout warning.

glad to see you found some new clothes.

comments.author: Nate
comments.body:
Several things:

1) The beard is really coming along.  Good work!

2) I see the Jabba!  That is wild, man.  The force is with my Rorschach (sp?) perception.

3) The cockroach source has been located...which is the Moxie version of the Sarlaac pit (sp?) I guess.

4) The cockroaches I think give the Moxie an Indiana Jones Temple of Doom type feel.  Lucas is all over the damned place.  Plus, you and Indiana are never without your hat.

5) Or whip.

comments.author: nicole
comments.body: I felt my insides crawling after finding out I was in the same room as 2000 giant cockroaches.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: You guys are really biased against cockroaches, aren't you? I bet if I found a pipe full of butterflies or lady bugs, no one would care... but as soon as I say cockroaches... I think they're kinda cute. I've named the one that lives in my left nostril. I call him Nostrilatu.

comments.author: steph v.
comments.body:
Gross.

But everything else looks like it's coming along...

comments.author: Evan Erwin
comments.body:
I recently sustained a muscle strain in my chest that makes laughing hurt.

You made me hurt. That's the best compliment I can give you.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: I'm glad I could hurt you, Evan.

comments.author: J.R.
comments.body: You almost made me lose it in the Library!

comments.author: erin
comments.body: that sure is some pretty duct work. 'a' plus.

comments.author: brian of moore
comments.body:
... reminds me of Joe's Apartment
... eh... well hey at least office space was good

comments.author: Nicki J
comments.body:
EW!

sell the cockroaches on ebay?

hey, you never know.
